title: Sampler, 1846
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: buttonhole, running and knotted stitches on plain weave
markings:
On the back of the frame is a hanging wire and two eye hooks.  It is covered with brown paper on which there are four stickers which read [descriptions in brackets belong to the author of this report]:

N No. 90     CG No. 219
Buttonhole Sampler: signed M.T. 1846
English
[white sticker with a double red line boarder; typed; 3” x 5”]

179     32.50
Ulercur Audurai Galleries
1846 Button Hole Sampler – American
2 samplers sold
Chelliuhaue Fewale orfhau
Asylum school of Industry 1805
[white sticker with a red boarder; hand written; 2 3/8” x 3 7/8”; appears thick and may have been cut off the back of a different frame and applied to this one]

Mrs. R. J. Mereur
[white sticker with a blue boarder; hand written; 1” x 3 _”; appears thick and may have been cut off the back of a different frame and applied to this one]

128183   279
[yellow sticker; askew on the side; typed; 5/8” x 7/8”]
dimensions: Frame H x W: 19.4 x 20 cm (7 5/8 x 7 7/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of Myra M. and William H. Mathers
description: Small sampler with decorative buttonholes worked in white on a white ground, with the inscription and date in red at center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1846. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: buttonhole, running and knotted stitches on plain weave. Gift of Myra M. and William H. Mathers. 2008-31-9.
